Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip, one line of cord-marked decoration and remains of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394909) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394909)
